00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to RAID block. This is not available on all chips.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 106514 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef __CVMX_RAID_H__
00049 #define __CVMX_RAID_H__

00052 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-rad-defs.h>

00055 #include "cvmx-fpa.h"

00063 /**
00064  * This structure defines the type of command words the RAID block
00065  * will accept.
00066  */
00067 typedef union {
00068     uint64_t u64;
00069     struct {
00070         uint64_t reserved_37_63:27;
00071                         /**< Must be zero */
00072         uint64_t q_cmp:1;       /**< Indicates whether the Q pipe is in normal mode (CWORD[Q_CMP]=0) or in non-zero
00073                                                 byte detect mode (CWORD[Q_CMP]=1).
00074                                                 In non-zero byte detect mode, the Q OWORD[PTR] result is the non-zero detect
00075                                                 result, which indicates the position of the first non-zero byte in the pipe result bytes.
00076                                                 CWORD[Q_CMP] must not be set when CWORD[QOUT]=0, and must not be set
00077                                                 when CWORD[Q_XOR] is set. */
00078         uint64_t p_cmp:1;       /**< Indicates whether the P pipe is in normal mode (CWORD[P_CMP]=0) or in non-zero
00079                                                 byte detect mode (CWORD[P_CMP]=1).
00080                                                 In non-zero byte detect mode, the P OWORD[PTR] result is the non-zero detect
00081                                                 result, which indicates the position of the first non-zero byte in the pipe result bytes.
00082                                                 CWORD[P_CMP] must not be set when CWORD[POUT]=0, and must not be set
00083                                                 when CWORD[P_XOR] is set. */
00084         uint64_t q_xor:1;       /**< Indicates whether the Q output buffer bytes are the normal Q pipe result or the
00085                                                 normal Q pipe result exclusive-OR'ed with the P pipe result.
00086                                                 When CWORD[Q_XOR]=0 (and CWORD[Q_CMP]=0), the Q output buffer bytes are
00087                                                 the normal Q pipe result, which does not include the P pipe result in any way.
00088                                                 When CWORD[Q_XOR]=1, the Q output buffer bytes are the normal Q pipe result
00089                                                 exclusive-OR'ed with the P pipe result, as if the P pipe result were another Q IWORD
00090                                                 for the Q pipe with QMULT=1.
00091                                                 CWORD[Q_XOR] must not be set unless both CWORD[POUT,QOUT] are set, and
00092                                                 must not be set when CWORD[Q_CMP] is set. */
00093         uint64_t p_xor:1;       /**< Indicates whether the P output buffer bytes are the normal P pipe result or the
00094                                                 normal P pipe result exclusive-OR'ed with the Q pipe result.
00095                                                 When CWORD[P_XOR]=0 (and CWORD[P_CMP]=0), the P output buffer bytes are
00096                                                 the normal P pipe result, which does not include the Q pipe result in any way.
00097                                                 When CWORD[P_XOR]=1, the P output buffer bytes are the normal P pipe result
00098                                                 exclusive-OR'ed with the Q pipe result, as if the Q pipe result were another P
00099                                                 IWORD for the P pipe.
00100                                                 CWORD[P_XOR] must not be set unless both CWORD[POUT,QOUT] are set, and
00101                                                 must not be set when CWORD[P_CMP] is set. */
00102         uint64_t wqe:1;         /**< Indicates whether RAD submits a work queue entry or writes an L2/DRAM byte to
00103                                                 zero after completing the instruction.
00104                                                 When CWORD[WQE] is set and RESP[PTR]!=0, RAD adds the work queue entry
00105                                                 indicated by RESP[PTR] to the selected POW input queue after completing the
00106                                                 instruction.
00107                                                 When CWORD[WQE] is clear and RESP[PTR]!=0, RAD writes the L2/DRAM byte
00108                                                 indicated by RESP[PTR] to zero after completing the instruction. */
00109         uint64_t qout:1;        /**< Indicates whether the Q pipe is used by this instruction.
00110                                                 If CWORD[QOUT] is set, IWORD[QEN] must be set for at least one IWORD.
00111                                                 At least one of CWORD[QOUT,POUT] must be set. */
00112         uint64_t pout:1;        /**< Indicates whether the P pipe is used by this instruction.
00113                                                 If CWORD[POUT] is set, IWORD[PEN] must be set for at least one IWORD.
00114                                                 At least one of CWORD[QOUT,POUT] must be set. */
00115         uint64_t iword:6;       /**< Indicates the number of input buffers used.
00116                                                 1 <= CWORD[IWORD] <= 32. */
00117         uint64_t size:24;       /**< Indicates the size in bytes of all input buffers. When CWORD[Q_CMP,P_CMP]=0,
00118                                                 also indicates the size of the Q/P output buffers.
00119                                                 CWORD[SIZE] must be a multiple of 8B (i.e. <2:0> must be zero). */
00120     } cword;
00121     struct {
00122         uint64_t reserved_58_63:6;
00123                         /**< Must be zero */
00124         uint64_t fw:1;          /**< When set, indicates that RAD can modify any byte in any (128B) cache line touched
00125                                                 by L2/DRAM addresses OWORD[PTR] through OWORD[PTR]+CWORD[SIZE]�1.
00126                                                 Setting OWORD[FW] can improve hardware performance, as some DRAM loads can
00127                                                 be avoided on L2 cache misses. The Q OWORD[FW] must not be set when
00128                                                 CWORD[Q_CMP] is set, and the P OWORD[FW] must not be set when
00129                                                 CWORD[P_CMP] is set. */
00130         uint64_t nc:1;          /**< When set, indicates that RAD should not allocate L2 cache space for the P/Q data on
00131                                                 L2 cache misses.
00132                                                 OWORD[NC] should typically be clear, though setting OWORD[NC] can improve
00133                                                 performance in some circumstances, as the L2 cache will not be polluted by P/Q data.
00134                                                 The Q OWORD[NC] must not be set when CWORD[Q_CMP] is set, and the P
00135                                                 OWORD[NC] must not be set when CWORD[P_CMP] is set. */
00136         uint64_t reserved_42_55:14;
00137                         /**< Must be zero */
00138         uint64_t addr:42;       /**< When CWORD[P_CMP,Q_CMP]=0, OWORD[PTR] indicates the starting address of
00139                                                 the L2/DRAM buffer that will receive the P/Q data. In the non-compare mode, the
00140                                                 output buffer receives all of the output buffer bytes.
00141                                                 When CWORD[P_CMP,Q_CMP]=1, the corresponding P/Q pipe is in compare mode,
00142                                                 and the only output of the pipe is the non-zero detect result. In this case,
00143                                                 OWORD[PTR] indicates the 8-byte location of the non-zero detect result. */
00144     } oword;
00145     struct {
00146         uint64_t reserved_57_63:7;
00147                         /**< Must be zero */
00148         uint64_t nc:1;          /**< When set, indicates that RAD should not allocate L2 cache space for this input buffer
00149                                                 data on L2 cache misses.
00150                                                 Setting IWORD[NC] may improve performance in some circumstances, as the L2
00151                                                 cache may not be polluted with input buffer data. */
00152         uint64_t reserved_50_55:6;
00153                         /**< Must be zero */
00154         uint64_t qen:1;         /**< Indicates that this input buffer data should participate in the Q pipe result.
00155                                                 The Q pipe hardware multiplies each participating input byte by IWORD[QMULT]
00156                                                 before accumulating them by exclusive-OR'ing.
00157                                                 IWORD[QEN] must not be set when CWORD[QOUT] is not set.
00158                                                 If CWORD[QOUT] is set, IWORD[QEN] must be set for at least one IWORD. */
00159         uint64_t pen:1;         /**< Indicates that this input buffer data should participate in the P pipe result.
00160                                                 The P pipe hardware accumulates each participating input byte by bit-wise
00161                                                 exclusive-OR'ing it.
00162                                                 IWORD[PEN] must not be set when CWORD[POUT] is not set.
00163                                                 If CWORD[POUT] is set, IWORD[PEN] must be set for at least one IWORD. */
00164         uint64_t qmult:8;       /**< The Q pipe multiplier for the input buffer. Section 26.1 above describes the GF(28)
00165                                                 multiplication algorithm.
00166                                                 IWORD[QMULT] must be zero when IWORD[QEN] is not set.
00167                                                 IWORD[QMULT] must not be zero when IWORD[QEN] is set.
00168                                                 When IWORD[QMULT] is 1, the multiplication simplifies to the identity function,
00169                                                 and the Q pipe performs the same XOR function as the P pipe. */
00170         uint64_t addr:40;       /**< The starting address of the input buffer in L2/DRAM.
00171                                                 IWORD[PTR] must be naturally-aligned on an 8 byte boundary (i.e. <2:0> must be
00172                                                 zero). */
00173     } iword;
00174     struct {
00175         uint64_t reserved_57_63:7;
00176                         /**< Must be zero */
00177         uint64_t nc:1;          /**< When set, indicates that RAD should not allocate L2 cache space for this input buffer
00178                                                 data on L2 cache misses.
00179                                                 Setting IWORD[NC] may improve performance in some circumstances, as the L2
00180                                                 cache may not be polluted with input buffer data. */
00181         uint64_t qen:1;         /**< Indicates that this input buffer data should participate in the Q pipe result.
00182                                                 The Q pipe hardware multiplies each participating input byte by IWORD[QMULT]
00183                                                 before accumulating them by exclusive-OR'ing.
00184                                                 IWORD[QEN] must not be set when CWORD[QOUT] is not set.
00185                                                 If CWORD[QOUT] is set, IWORD[QEN] must be set for at least one IWORD. */
00186         uint64_t pen:1;         /**< Indicates that this input buffer data should participate in the P pipe result.
00187                                                 The P pipe hardware accumulates each participating input byte by bit-wise
00188                                                 exclusive-OR'ing it.
00189                                                 IWORD[PEN] must not be set when CWORD[POUT] is not set.
00190                                                 If CWORD[POUT] is set, IWORD[PEN] must be set for at least one IWORD. */
00191         uint64_t qmult:8;       /**< The Q pipe multiplier for the input buffer. Section 26.1 above describes the GF(28)
00192                                                 multiplication algorithm.
00193                                                 IWORD[QMULT] must be zero when IWORD[QEN] is not set.
00194                                                 IWORD[QMULT] must not be zero when IWORD[QEN] is set.
00195                                                 When IWORD[QMULT] is 1, the multiplication simplifies to the identity function,
00196                                                 and the Q pipe performs the same XOR function as the P pipe. */
00197         uint64_t reserved_43_46:4;
00198                         /**< Must be zero */
00199         uint64_t addr:42;       /**< The starting address of the input buffer in L2/DRAM.
00200                                                 IWORD[PTR] must be naturally-aligned on an 8 byte boundary (i.e. <2:0> must be
00201                                                 zero). */
00202     } iword_78xx;
00203     struct {
00204         uint64_t reserved_40_63:22;
00205         uint64_t addr:42;
00206     } respword;
00207 } cvmx_raid_word_t;
00208 
00209 typedef struct
00210 {
00211     cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t command_queue_pool;
00212 }cvmx_raid_config_t;
00213 
00214 extern CVMX_SHARED cvmx_raid_config_t raid_config;
00215 
00216 static inline int64_t cvmx_fpa_get_raid_pool(void)
00217 {
00218     return (raid_config.command_queue_pool.pool_num);
00219 }
00220 
00221 static inline uint64_t cvmx_fpa_get_raid_pool_block_size(void)
00222 {
00223     return (raid_config.command_queue_pool.buffer_size);
00224 }
00225 
00226 /**
00227  * Sets the internal FPA pool data structure for raid comamnd queue.
00228  * @param pool  fpa pool number to use
00229  * @param buffer_size   buffer size of pool
00230  * @param buffer_count  number of buufers to allocate to pool
00231  */
00232 void cvmx_raid_set_cmd_que_pool_config(int64_t pool, uint64_t buffer_size,
00233                   uint64_t buffer_count);
00234 
00235 /**
00236  * Gets the internal FPA pool data structure for raid comamnd queue.
00237  * @param cmd_que_pool  Pointer to cmd que pool where data gets copied
00238  */
00239 void cvmx_raid_get_cmd_que_pool_config(cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t* cmd_que_pool);
00240 
00241 /**
00242  * Initialize the RAID block
00243  *
00244  * @param polynomial Coefficients for the RAID polynomial
00245  *
00246  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00247  */
00248 int cvmx_raid_initialize(cvmx_rad_reg_polynomial_t polynomial);
00249 
00250 /**
00251  * Shutdown the RAID block. RAID must be idle when
00252  * this function is called.
00253  *
00254  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00255  */
00256 int cvmx_raid_shutdown(void);
00257 
00258 /**
00259  * Submit a command to the RAID block
00260  *
00261  * @param num_words Number of command words to submit
00262  * @param words     Command words
00263  *
00264  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00265  */
00266 int cvmx_raid_submit(int num_words, cvmx_raid_word_t words[]);
00267 
00268 void cvmx_raid_config_control_word(cvmx_raid_word_t *word, int number_input_blocks, int block_length, int qout, int pout, int qcmp, int pcmp, int qxor, int pxor, int wqe);
00269 void cvmx_raid_config_input_word(cvmx_raid_word_t *word, int qen, uint64_t qmult, int pen, uint64_t input_ptr);
00270 void cvmx_raid_config_output_word(cvmx_raid_word_t *word, int no_cache, uint64_t output_ptr);
00271 void cvmx_raid_config_resp_word(cvmx_raid_word_t *word, uint64_t resp_ptr);
